isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER AUTOMATE-2 - TROUBLESHOOTING (ELECTRICAL) - REMOVING AND REPLACING SHIFT SOLENOIDS

svcproc.title: REMOVING AND REPLACING SHIFT SOLENOIDS
svcproc.para: This procedure is used when the coil of the solenoid has been confirmed defective. Perform this procedure for the Neutral Shift Solenoid, as well as the 9th and 10th Gear Shift Solenoids because they are nearly identical valves.

step1.para: Remove the 1/4 inch OD nylon tubing from the top exhaust port of the shift valve. Use two wrenches to remove the fitting from the valve exhaust port.
Remove the 2 pin electrical connector from the coil of the valve to be replaced.
With a 1-3/8 inch wrench, turn the valve counterclockwise using the hex at the base of the valve. After the valve is removed, remove the O-rings from the bottom of the valve manifold.

Clean any residual O-ring lubricant and remove all foreign matter from the manifold. New O-rings should be included with the new valve. Liberally coat the new O-rings with Parker O-ring lubricant or the equivalent.
Place O-rings in their respective grooves at the bottom of the valve manifold. Apply Loctite #242 or an equivalent thread lock to threads of the new valve.
Install the new valve by screwing it in clockwise and tightening it to 12 to 15 ft-Ibs. (16 to 20 N· m).
Remove the elbow fitting from the exhaust port of the defective valve and screw the fitting into the exhaust port of the new valve.
Replace nylon tubing to the elbow/tee fitting. Connect the electrical connector to the valve coil connector.
This should correct the fault. If it does not, go to the next step listed in the Problem-List.
